definition: head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: In Nixon's tenure, the United States held three Soviet summit.
sentences.chinese: 在尼克松任期内，美苏共举行了三次首脑会晤。

sentences.english: The heads of two governments met to ratify the peace treaty.
sentences.chinese: 两国政府首脑会晤批准和平条约。

sentences.english: Just as the two countries prepare for their presidents to meet, bickering has broken out.
sentences.chinese: 正当两国准备首脑会晤之际，双方爆发了争吵。

sentences.english: The heads of the three sides met to ratify the trade treaty.
sentences.chinese: 三方首脑会晤批准贸易条约。

definition: summit talks/discussion between heads of state
Yang Jiechi (1950-), Chinese politician and diplomat, foreign minister of PRC 2007-2013
Mike Pence (1959-), US Republican politician, US vice president from 2017
North and South Korea/bilateral Korean relations
Lavrov (name)/Sergey Viktorovich Lavrov (1950-), Russian diplomat and politician, Foreign minister from 2004
